title: What's the Difference Between Panpsychism and Idealism?
description: This is a clip from Philip's Christmas 2025 "Ask Me Anything" video from his Substack. The full video is freely available here: https://philipgoff.substack.com/p/does-the-holy-spirit-the-quantum

title: Leading Neuroscientist on his Near Death Experience
description: This is from a longer interview Philip had with neuroscientist Christof Koch about his mystical experience. You can see the full discussion here: https://philipgoff.substack.com/p/pioneering-neuroscientist-has-mystical

title: The Landscape of Consciousness at Christmas (landscape format)
description:
Mind Chat is back! In this live Christmas episode, Philip and Keith's guest is Robert Lawrence Kuhn. Among many other roles, Robert is the creator, writer, host and executive producer of the PBS TV series Closer To Truth and the creator of a comprehensive survey of theories of consciousness titled _A Landscape of Consciousness_

We will be talking to Robert about his lifelong quest to get closer to the truth about consciousness, existence, and ultimate reality. 

Links
- Robert's website https://rlkuhn.com/
- _Closer to Truth_ website https://closertotruth.com/
- _The Landscape of Consciousness_ website https://loc.closertotruth.com/
- _What 350 different theories of consciousness reveal about reality_ https://www.newscientist.com/article/2498968-what-350-different-theories-of-consciousness-reveal-about-reality/
- _Striving to Get Closer To Truth_ https://medium.com/@CloserToTruth/striving-to-get-closer-to-truth-953d7b869e0f
- _Levels of Nothing_ https://closertotruth.com/news/levels-of-nothing-by-robert-lawrence-kuhn/

üéôÔ∏è New to streaming or looking to level up? Check out StreamYard and get $10 discount! üòç https://streamyard.com/pal/d/6373807122284544

title: Christmas Chat/Q&A
description: Keith and Philip are going to have a chat and then answer questions from viewers.

title: S04E06 Andy Clark: The Experience Machine
description: Andy Clark is leading and incredibly influential philosopher and cognitive scientist. Among other things, Andy has done pioneering work on predictive processing and the extended mind thesis. Here Keith and Philip discuss with Andy his most recent book 'The Experience Machine.' https://www.theguardian.com/books/2023/may/04/the-experience-machine-how-our-minds-predict-and-shape-reality-review

title: Heretical Christianity
description:
Philip recently went public with his conversion to a heretical form of Christianity (see article and video below). In this episode Keith and Philip will   discuss this and open up to Q&A. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vM_Thg165O8&t=70s
https://aeon.co/.../i-now-think-a-heretical-form-of...
IMPORTANT NOTE: I accidentally said that "Jesus" didn't approve of gay sex, but I meant to say "Paul." Philip
Please consider supporting us on Patreon: $2 a month to keep the show going, or $10 a month to have a chat with Keith and/or Philip after each episode: https://www.patreon.com/MindChat

title: S04E05 Annaka Harris: Is Consciousness Everywhere?
description:
Annaka Harris is author of bestselling book "Conscious" and writer and producer of the forthcoming audio documentary series "Lights On." In this episode we mainly focused on panpsychism, although we also touched on free will and the self. Annaka is sympathetic to panpsychism, so Philip and Annaka compared their reasons for taking the view seriously, whilst Keith and Annaka tried to work out why they disagreed. 

Please consider supporting us on Patreon: $2 a month to keep the show going, or $10 a month to have a chat with Keith and/or Philip after each episode: https://www.patreon.com/MindChat

Here's some other recent cool stuff from Annaka:
https://annakaharris.com/the-strong-assumption/
https://annakaharris.com/is-consciousness-fundamental/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hp_c-vchgSE

title: S04E04  Sarah Lane-Ritchie & Aidan Lyon: What Can Psychedelics Tell Us About Mind & Reality?
description:
Can taking psychedelics teach us more about the mind than science and philosophy? Is it rational to trust what mystical experiences seem to be telling us about ultimate reality? These are questions Keith and Philip would like the answers to, and apparently Sarah Lane-Ritchie and Aidan Lyon have them. Join us to find out what they are!

00:00 ‚Äì Remembering Daniel Dennett
4:28 ‚Äì Mind Chat news
6:33 ‚Äì Introducing Sarah and Aidan 
15:22 ‚Äì What is a Psychedelic Experience?
26:34 ‚Äì Can we trust Mystical Experiences? 
42:19 ‚Äì Hallucinations
43:59 ‚Äì The Nature of Reality
46:52 ‚Äì Ineffability
55:11 ‚Äì How can Psychedelics help us to do Philosophy?
1:00:37 ‚Äì Embracing Uncertainty
1:02:43 ‚Äì Philip‚Äôs teenage Psychedelic Experience
1:04:59 ‚Äì Breaking through Cultural Conditioning
1:10:54 ‚Äì Wisdom and Empathy
1:10:54 ‚Äì The Importance of Uncertainty
11:13:49 ‚Äì God and the Mathematics of Infinity 
1:15:01‚Äì How can Psychedelics help with Theology? 
1:18:14 Q&A
1:36:35 Phil and Keith Banter & Mind Chat Catchphrase

title: S0403 Kevin Mitchell: Do We Have Free Will?
description:
Kevin Mitchell is Associate Professor of Genetics and Neuroscience at Trinity College Dublin. He is also the author of the wonderful recent book 'Free Agents: How Evolution Gave us Free will', a robust defence of the reality of free will.  Between the three of us, we aim to definitely establish whether or not humans are free.

Mind Chat now has a Patreon!!  
https://www.patreon.com/MindChat
Pledge:
$2 a month, to keep the show going.
$10 a month for 30 min after show chat with Philip & Keith

For more on Kevin Mitchell
https://press.princeton.edu/books/hardcover/9780691226231/free-agents
https://www.kjmitchell.com/

0:00 ‚Äì Amusing Banter
4:41 ‚Äì Introducing Kevin Mitchell
6:07 ‚Äì Kevin‚Äôs view
16:12 ‚Äì The Philosophy of Free Will
29:03 ‚Äì Keith Probes Kevin
51:25 ‚Äì Philip and Keith disagree on how to interpret Kevin‚Äôs position
1:01:00 ‚Äì Does quantum mechanics help?
1:24:12 ‚Äì Keith can‚Äôt help himself
1:30:24 ‚Äì Philip mutes Keith
1:30:57 ‚Äì Audience Q&A
1:43:33 ‚Äì Final banter and Mind Chat catchphrase

title: Philip Pullman and Philip Goff discuss 'Why? The Purpose of the Universe.'
description: To launch Philip Goff's book 'Why? The Purpose of the Universe,' public philosopher Nigel Warburton hosted a discussion between Philip Pullman and Philip Goff on meaning, purpose, and the big questions of philosophy. This took place on 10th November 2023 at Blackwells bookshop in Oxford. This video by the excellent Consciousness Matters channel: https://www.youtube.com/@UCS6T9SVpxt0ko-r45jIEyAw

title: S04E02 Cat Gillen: Do Electrons Exist?
description:
Recently Philip and Sabine Hossenfelder had a discussion on Twitter about the relationship between science and the entities referred to in scientific theories: https://twitter.com/Philip_Goff/status/1725487476695830778. We're going to interview philosopher of science doctoral candidate Cat Gillen (Durham University) on the debates between realists and instrumentalists in the philosophy of science.

Mind Chat now has a Patreon!!  
https://www.patreon.com/MindChat
Pledge:
$2 a month, to keep the show going.
$10 a month for 30 min after show chat with Philip & Keith

title: Arguments against Physicalism
description: This is a recording of my first lecture on 'Arguments against Physicalism' for my Philosophy of Mind course at Durham University.

title: S04E01 Halloween Special! The Purpose of the Universe
description:
Keith and Philip will discuss Philip's new book 'Why? The Purpose of the Universe.' https://www.amazon.co.uk/Why-Purpose-Universe-Philip-Goff/dp/0198883765

Mind Chat now has a Patreon!!  
https://www.patreon.com/MindChat
Pledge:
$2 a month, to keep the show going.
$10 a month for 30 min after show chat with Philip & Keith

For further discussion on 'Why? The Purpose of the Universe,' see Philip's interview on the excellent 'Majesty of Reason' podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dSNN3BlCnzk

title: Sean Carroll & Philip Goff Debate 'Is Consciousness Fundamental?'
description:
This debate took place in Marist College on Friday September 8th 2023. It was one of the public components of a conference on the topic of panpsychism organised by Andrei Buckareff and Philip Goff, as part of the Templeton funded project 'Panpsychism and Pan(en)theism: Philosophy of Religion meets Philosophy of Mind.' https://sites.google.com/view/panpsychismandpanentheism/home 
Filmed and edited by Jay Shapiro.

title: S03E06 Donald Hoffman: What is Reality?
description:
Donald Hoffman is a cognitive scientist at UC Irvine and author of 'The Case Against Reality.' He believes that the world we experience is an illusion, whilst ultimate reality is composed of networks of conscious agents. Keith and Philip will probe Professor Hoffman's view from their very different perspectives on the nature of consciousness.

Here's the paper we discussed at length which argues that Donald's argument from evolution is self-defeating: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11229-022-04021-1

Here's Donald's recent co-written paper in which the authors attempt to ground physics in networks of conscious agents: https://www.mdpi.com/1099-4300/25/1/129

0:00 - Intros
2:36 - The Case Against Reality
24:52 - Consciousness as Fundamental
30:46 - Philip's Objection to Hoffman's Argument from Physics
44:28 - Integrated Information Theory
50:48 - What Philip Stole from Hoffman
52:32 - Is Hoffman's Evolution Argument Self-Defeating?
1:04:43 - Keith Probes into the Details
1:21:24 - Buddhism
1:25:35 - Panpsychism vs. Hoffman's View
1:32:41 - Is Hoffman an Illusionist?
1:35:41 - Ockham's Razor
1:37:47 - Why Hoffman Doesn't Believe in Evolution
1:44:09 - Alvin Plantinga's Evolutionary Argument
1:47:56 - Q&A
1:56:26 - Find Out More About Hoffman
1:58:15 - Philip's Conference
1:58:42 - Mind Chat Catchphrase

title: What are Large Language Models Doing?
description: In this solo talk Keith will ask whether large language models perform intentional actions. From an interpretivist perspective, there is a prima facie case for thinking that they do, yet it is implausible to think that LLMs possess communicative intentions and perform speech acts. Keith will suggest a solution to this problem, arguing that we should interpret LLMs as making moves in a narrowly defined language game, motivated solely by a desire to play the game.

title: S03E05 Eric Schwitzgebel: Is the United States Conscious?
description:
Eric Schwitzgebel is professor of Philosophy at the University of California, Riverside. His research interests include philosophy of psychology, philosophy of mind, moral psychology, classical Chinese philosophy, epistemology, metaphilosophy, and metaphysics. He has also written a number of pieces of philosophical science fiction, which have been published in leading science fiction magazines.
Timings:
0:00 - Intro
3:08 - Is the United States Conscious?
24:52 - Philip's View on Whether the US is Conscious
27:16 - Keith's View on Whether the US is Conscious
45:53 - Do Panpsychists Think the US is Conscious?
46:42 - Does Eric Believe the US is Conscious?
47:46 - Philip Shocks Keith
48:27 - Is Consciousness Vague?
53:48 - The Vagueness Argument for Panpsychism
56:07 - Philip's Argument that Consciousness isn't Vague
1:00:57 - The Vagueness Argument for Illusionism
1:02:17 - Does Introspection Reveal the Essence of Consciousness?
1:15:44 - The Integrated Information Theory 
1:19:27 - The AI of Daniel Dennett
1:23:50 - Ethical Problems of AI
1:26:40 - The Benefits of AI
1:31:41 - Will AI Change it Means to be a Person?
1:34:06 - Do AI Have Rights?
1:29:18 - Can AI Give us Immortality?
1:38:02 - Why AI Needs Philosophy
1:39:31 - Q&A
1:53:35 - A Surprise Twist on the Mind Chat Catchphrase

title: Philip and Keith reunion
description: Philip and Keith have a moving reunion and annouce and the next two Mind Chat guests. Filmed in a windy Oxford on 13 April 2023.

title: The Ethical Implications of Illusionism
description: Keith will present a short solo episode on the ethical implications of illusionism. He will briefly introduce illusionism for newcomers, respond to the accusation that the view has negative ethical implications, and go on to argue that its implications for ethics are in fact benign and constructive. He will then answer questions from live viewers.

title: The Mystery of Psycho-Physical Harmony
description: This month Philip will do a solo episode on the mystery of psycho-physical harmony. Philip will spend 20 minutes outlining the problem (and why he thinks it's going to change the world), and will then answer questions from live viewers.

title: S03E04 Liu & Machery: Is the 'Hard Problem of Consciousness' Nonsense Invented by Philosophers?
description: Many philosophers worry about David Chalmers' 'hard problem' of how brains produce consciousness. But do ordinary people who haven't been exposed to the peculiarities of academic philosopher share Chalmers' intuition that there's a problem here? Professor Edouard Machery (University of Pittsburgh-Carnegie Mellon University) answers 'no.' Machery thinks the concept of 'phenomenal consciousness' that gives rise to these intuitions is an invention of academic philosophers, and he's built an empirical case to support his view, based on interviews with the general public. Dr Michelle Liu (University of Hertfordshire-Monash) has responded to the arguments of Machery and others, suggesting they may be ignoring to polysemous nature of language. Keith and Philip will host a friendly debate/discussion between Machery and Liu, whilst trying to resist the temptation to bring the discussion back to panpsychism and illusionism.

title: S03E03 Frank Jackson: The Greatest Argument Against Materialism
description: Professor Frank Jackson (Australian National University) came up with one of the most influential arguments against materialism about consciousness, a version of the 'knowledge argument', involving the story of Black and White Mary. Ironically, Jackson later recanted and is now a committed materialist. Keith and Philip will discuss with Frank the knowledge argument, why he changed his mind, and what he thinks about consciousness now. (Philip secretly hopes to bring Frank back to the fold of anti-materialists, but it's a long shot).

title: S03E02 Kammerer & Roelofs: Illusionism or Panpsychism? Mind Chat (delayed) Christmas Special 2022
description:
Mind Chat is back!! We've been a bit delayed due to illness in the family and Philip needing to finish a book. This is our delayed Christmas special, and will involve sherry, mince pies, and Christmas jumpers. Last Christmas special, Keith and Philip debated illusionism versus panpsychism. This year, we thought we'd invite a leading illusionist and panpsychist from the next generation of thinkers. Dr Francois Kammerer and Dr Luke Roelofs are both Postdoctoral Research Associates at the Centre for Mind, Brain, and Consciousness at New York University. They have both done incredibly interesting and provocative work defending illusionism and panpsychism, respectively. We're going to have a formal debate-style show, with a Twitter Poll to decide which view is correct. But as you might expect from Mind Chat, this is more in the spirit of fun than a macho fight to prove who's right. 

https://www.francoiskammerer.com/
https://www.lukeroelofs.com/

title: All or Nothing: Philip and Keith present their rival views of consciousness
description: Philip Goff presents the case for panpsychism and Keith Frankish that for illusionism in these online presentations to the Mind and Matter group at the University of Helsinki. Followed by a brief discussion between Philip and Keith. Recorded 13 January 2023.

title: Mind Chat News November 2022
description: Philip talks to forthcoming Mind Chat guests Annaka Harris and Donald Hoffman, in a short video filmed in LA by film director Lucy Walker.

title: S03E01 Noam Chomsky on Consciousness
description: Noam Chomsky is an intellectual giant, who has made major contributions to linguistics, philosophy, and cognitive science. In this episode Keith and Philip will explore Professor Chomsky's views on consciousness and the mind.

title: Mind Chat Season 3 News
description: Philip and Keith meet in person for the first time since 2014 and share some exciting news about season 3 of Mind Chat.

title: S02E08 Angela Mendelovici: How Does Consciousness Connect us to Reality? Part II
description:
Angela Mendelovici (University of Western Ontorio) is a prominent proponent of the 'Phenomenal Intentionality Theory': the view that all mental representation is at least partly grounded in consciousness. This view contrasts with David Papineau's as to how consciousness connects us to reality, which we discussed in an earlier episode. Our main focus will be to explore the Phenomenal Intentionality Theory, but Angela also happens to be a panpsychist, so Philip is hoping this will finally be a guest that agrees with him more than Keith.

https://publish.uwo.ca/~amendel5/

title: S02E07 Ann-Sophie Barwich: Smellosophy: The Philosophy & Neuroscience of Smell
description:
Ann-Sophie Barwich is a cognitive scientist and empirical philosopher, and author of 'Smellosophy: What the Nose Tells the Mind' (Harvard University Press). Ann-Sophie explores how the neuroscience of smell challenges philosophical assumptions about the nature of perception. 
http://www.smellosophy.com/
https://www.hup.harvard.edu/catalog.php?isbn=9780674983694

title: S02E06b Is Physics Different in the Brain?
description: Philip wants to share some reflections on the recent discussion 'What Does Physics Tell Us About Consciousness?' with Sean Carroll and Barry Loewer.

title: S02E06 Carroll & Loewer: What Does Physics Tell Us About Consciousness?
description:
We previously had a long chat with Sean Carroll. A big bone of contention with Philip and Sean was the degree to which physics constrains our theory of consciousness. We decided it would be good to explore this issue in its own right, with a bit of help from esteemed philosophy of physics Barry Loewer (Rutgers University). These are Sean's articles we discuss (the latter is a response to Philip's book 'Galileo's Error'):
https://arxiv.org/abs/2101.07884
https://philpapers.org/rec/CARCAT-33
Philip did a short addendum to this video the following week: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlyKdirhOa4&t=2900s

title: S02E05 Helen Steward: Do We Have Free Will?
description:
Helen Steward is a philosopher and author of 'A Metaphysics for Freedom' (Oxford University Press), which argues that agency itself‚Äîand not merely the special, distinctively human variety of it‚Äîis incompatible with determinism. Keith and Philip will Mind Chat with Helen about whether we have free will, and what that would entail about the ultimate nature of reality.

https://oxford.universitypressscholarship.com/view/10.1093/acprof:oso/9780199552054.001.0001/acprof-9780199552054

For those interested in hearing about/supporting staff striking in UK universities: https://www.ucu.org.uk/article/12100/...

title: S02E04 David Papineau: How Does Consciousness Connect Us To Reality?
description:
Keith and Philip interview David Papineau (Professor of Philosophy at King's College London) about his recent book 'The Metaphysics of Sensory Experience.' David is also a materialist who believes in consciousness, so there'll probably be a big old fight about that too. 
Link to David's book: https://global.oup.com/academic/product/the-metaphysics-of-sensory-experience-9780198862390?cc=gb&lang=en&
For those interested in hearing about/supporting striking UK lecturers: https://www.ucu.org.uk/article/12100/Ten-days-of-strike-action-begins-at-UK-universities

title: S02E03 David Chalmers: Are We Living in a Simulation?
description:
David Chalmers is one of the most important and influential philosophers of consciousness on the contemporary scene. He coined the phrase 'the hard problem of consciousness', and defends 'naturalistic dualism' as an alternative to materialism. In his new book 'Reality+', aimed at a general audience, David explores the big questions of philosophy through the lens of virtual reality. He argues that we don't know whether or not we are in a computer simulation, but that even if we are, it doesn't follow that the physical world around is isn't real. It just means the ultimate nature of the physical world is computational!

http://consc.net/reality/

title: S02E02 Panpsychism or Illusionism? Mind Chat Christmas Special
description: In the Mind Chat Christmas special, Keith and Philip will take it in turns to interrogate each other about their favoured view of consciousness (illusionism and panpsychism, respectively), based in part on viewers' questions. The episode will culminate in a 15 min twitter poll, in which viewers will decide once and for all whether panpsychism or illusionism is the correct view of consciousness. Christmas jumpers will be worn, sherry will be drunk, mince pies will be eaten. It's going to be lots of fun!

title: S02E01 Sean Carroll: Is Consciousness Emergent?
description:
Theoretical physicist Sean Carroll joins us to discuss whether it make sense to think of consciousness as an emergent phenomenon, and whether contemporary physics points in this direction.

We discussed Sean's essay responding to Philip's book 'Galileo's Error,' and Philip's counter-response essay. Both are available here: https://conscienceandconsciousness.com/2021/08/01/19-essays-on-galileos-error/

We also discussed Philip's Scientific American article making the case that the move from the fine-tuning to the multiverse commits the 'inverse gambler's fallacy': https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/our-improbable-existence-is-no-evidence-for-a-multiverse/#:~:text=We%20exist%2C%20and%20we%20are,with%20the%20existence%20of%20life.

Finally, Keith and Philip discussed the PhilPapers 2020 survey of philosophers' opinions on philosophical questions, which is linked to from this blog post of Philip's: https://conscienceandconsciousness.com/2021/11/01/materialism-remains-the-majority-view-but-only-just/

title: Welcome to Mind Chat!
description:
Philip and Keith introduce Mind Chat, reflect on Series 1, and announce the guests for Series 2.
If you have a question for the Mind Chat Christmas special AMA, please email it to mindchat2014@gmail.com

title: S01E06 Helen Yetter-Chappell: Is Reality Made up of Consciousness?
description:
Dr Helen Yetter-Chappell is Assistant Professor of Philosophy at University of Miami. Idealism is the view that the fundamental nature of reality is made up of mentality or consciousness. Inspired by the 18th century idealist philosophy George Berkeley, Helen has developed a version of Berkeley's idealism which dispenses with his commitment to the existence of God.

http://yetterchappell.net/Helen/

title: S01E05 Anil Seth: Is Consciousness a Controlled Hallucination?
description:
Anil Seth is Professor of Cognitive and Computational Neuroscience at the University of Sussex. In this episode we discuss his new book 'Being You: The New Science of Consciousness.' 

Anil's critique of Philip's panpsychism, and Philip's responses are available here: https://conscienceandconsciousness.com/2021/08/01/19-essays-on-galileos-error/

Info about Anil's book launch event at the Royal Institution can be found here:
https://www.rigb.org/whats-on/events-2021/september/public-being-you

Anil and Philip will be both be speaking at 'How the Light Gets In' festival in London September 18/19 (in fact, Philip will be singing too!) https://howthelightgetsin.org/festivals/september

title: S01E04 Matthias Michel: Is a Science of Consciousness Possible?
description: Matthias Michel is a philosopher whose work focuses on the science of consciousness. In a recent paper he outlines how scientists working on consciousness have been having the same debates for 150 years without reaching consensus. In this episode, we will explore why the science of consciousness is more challenging than other scientific endeavours and examine possible ways forward.

title: S01E03 Christof Koch: Introduction
description: Philip introduces our interview with Christof Koch on the Integrated Information Theory of consciousness.

title: S01E03 Christof Koch: The Integrated Information Theory of Consciousness
description: Christof Koch is a neuroscientist and proponent of the integrated information theory of consciousness, or 'IIT". In this episode we explore with Christof the science and philosophy of IIT. Unfortunately Philip forgot to press 'record' at the start (!) but all that's missing is introductions. The video starts just as Christof starts to explain the essence of IIT.

title: S01E02 Janet Levin: The Materialist Theory of Consciousness
description: Professor Janet Levin is a materialist about consciousness. She thinks our feelings and experiences are identical with physical processes in the brain. In this episode we will explore Janet's position and how she responds to arguments that try to show that consciousness alludes physical explanation.

title: S01E01 Tim O'Connor: Interview with a Dualist
description:
Tim O'Connor is a dualist: someone who thinks consciousness is not physical. People tend to think of dualists as believing in the soul, a supernatural entity distinct from the physical workings of the body and the brain. However, Tim's dualism is very different. He thinks consciousness resides in the brain, and is brought into existence by the physical particles that ultimately make up the brain. Nonetheless he rejects the idea that we can explain consciousness in terms of the kind of electro-chemical signalling of the brain. Instead, Tim is Strong Emergentist: He thinks that particles have special powers to produce non-physical consciousness, powers that only kick in when the particles are arranged in the special combinations we find in brains. To put it another way: the brain as a whole is more than the sum of its parts. 

Tim's website: https://toconnor.org/
Tim's entry on ''Emergent Properties' for the Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy: https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/properties-emergent/
